oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tennessee: Facts for Home Seekers
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture; Settlements; Rivers; Weather; Census; Minerals; Farming; Livestock; Pamphlets
Agriculture; Tennessee River; Cumberland River, Big South Fork (Tenn. and Ky.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ten page, soffcover, booklet detailing the advantages of settlement in Tennessee. The booklet describes the natural and man-made resources of Tennessee.

This type of promotional literature offered an important avenue to explore the historical development of Tennessee and the many opportunities for those interested in settlement. In the late 1890's and the early 1900's, promotional literature often championed the agricultural, the healthful and cathartic value of the Tennessee climate and geography. This booklet, completed in 1897, was sponsored by Tennessee's Bureau of Agriculture.
